Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a bust of Heliosarapis, upheld by two erotes; behind the bust is the disc of the rising sun, surrounded by rays. The upper part of the angular shoulder is decorated with chain pattern in relief. At the rear is a ring handle, the spine of which divides into a fork on the underside. The nozzle is damaged. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2050.bis)
